data.title: Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black Filming Locations
data.meta_description: Tyler Perry's Divorce in the Black, directed by Tyler Perry, shows the poignant tale of Ava (Meagan Good), a young bank clerk whose life is turned upside down
data.text:
Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black, directed by Tyler Perry, shows the poignant tale of Ava (Meagan Good), a young bank clerk whose life is turned upside down when her husband Dallas (Cory Hardrict) unexpectedly leaves her. Determined to save her marriage, Ava confronts obstacles as she uncovers unpleasant secrets about Dallas that imperil their relationship and her chances at real love. The video, produced for Amazon Prime, leverages its graphics to highlight themes of marital strife and the quest for freedom, all set against a backdrop of appropriate places.

Where was “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” Filmed?

The main shooting for “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” took place in the southern state of Georgia in June 2023, primarily in Atlanta and some scenes in Savannah. The cinematography, led by Michael Watson, cleverly uses dim lighting to enhance the film’s intense atmosphere. Production designer Sharon Busse and set decorator Gretchen Gattuso captured the emotional depth of the story through their meticulous set designs.

Atlanta, Georgia

Atlanta, Georgia’s capital city, was the film’s principal setting. Tyler Perry Studios on Deshler Street Southwest was where the majority of the filming took place. This large studio supported Perry’s efficient filming schedule, allowing the ensemble to keep up with production demands without becoming exhausted. The clip depicts Atlanta’s renowned skyline and includes scenes at 6940 Roswell Road and the Georgia Institute of Technology.

Scenes were also shot at CODA, a mixed-use development on West Peachtree Street Northwest that doubled as Ava’s office. Cory Hardrict, who portrays Dallas, lauded Perry’s quick but high-quality production process, highlighting the fast workflow and minimum downtime that kept everyone focused.

Savannah, Georgia

In addition to Atlanta, “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” captured scenes in Savannah, about 250 miles east of Atlanta. Savannah’s coastal charm provided a serene contrast to the turmoil within Ava and Dallas’ relationship, emphasizing the film’s theme of liberation from unhappy marriages. Significant scenes were shot at Saint Bartholomew’s Episcopal Church of Burroughs, adding historical depth to the storyline.

Atlanta and Savannah have both established themselves as popular filming destinations, attracting a wide range of film and television projects due to their diversified settings and vibrant production environments.

“Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” makes use of Georgia filming sites to enhance its storyline, from the bustling streets of Atlanta to the peaceful coastlines of Savannah. These surroundings not only serve as backdrops, but also add to the emotional depth of the individuals’ journeys, making the film a captivating exploration of love, loss, and resilience in the face of adversity.

Official Trailer

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) – Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black

Q: Where was “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” filmed?

A: “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” was primarily filmed in Atlanta, Georgia, at locations such as Tyler Perry Studios and CODA. Some scenes were also shot in Savannah, Georgia, providing a contrast between urban and coastal settings.

Q: When was “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” filmed?

A: Principal photography of “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” took place in Georgia, specifically Atlanta and Savannah, in June 2023. The production team used these sites to convey the story’s emotional arc.

Q: What is the release date of “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black”?

A: “Tyler Perry’s Divorce in the Black” was released on July 11, 2024.
